This ad was shown to you based on emails from your mailbox and information from your Google account, and may also be based on information you gave to the advertiser, which the advertiser provided to Google. ^1.
This ad was shown to you based on emails from your mailbox and information from your Google Account.
This ad is based on advertisers who want to reach people interested in value goods and services, and may also be based on emails from your mailbox and information from your Google account. ^1.

This ad is based on advertisers who want to reach people interested in very high-end goods and services, and may also be based on emails from your mailbox and information from your Google account. ^1.
This ad is based on advertisers who want to reach people interested in high-end goods and services, and may also be based on emails from your mailbox and information from your Google account. ^1.

This ad is based on advertisers who want to reach people interested in both high-end and mainstream goods and services, and may also be based on emails from your mailbox and information from your Google account. ^1.
This ad is based on advertisers who want to reach people interested in mainstream goods and services, and may also be based on emails from your mailbox and information from your Google account. ^1.

This ad is based on advertisers who want to reach people interested in both mainstream and value goods and services, and may also be based on emails from your mailbox and information from your Google account. ^1.
This ad was shown to you based on non-personalized information, such as Gmail language, general location (for example, country or city) and time of day.
This ad was shown to you based on your visit to the advertiser’s website and/or app. This ad is not an email and Google does not sell your email address to anyone. ^1.
For faster access, add Gmail to your Home screen.
Be careful with this message. Someone might be trying to trick you by using similar-looking characters (such as Σ and E) in the email addresses contained in this message.
This action has been disabled. Contact your IT admin to learn more.
Always show pictures from this sender
Pictures from this sender will be shown automatically.
This email claims to come from %2$s, but replies will go to an email address at another domain.
Be careful with this message. It might contain a virus or a malicious link.
You will be able to read your email through the %1$s app.

A value from 0-5 that represents the time window for syncing with EAS (Exchange ActiveSync). Defaults to one week (value=3). [0=No filter, synchronize all items. 1=1 day. 2=3 days. 3=1 week. 4=2 weeks. 5=1 month.] See https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg709713(v=exchg.80).aspx for complete information about sync window settings.
A string comprising the default email signature to be appended to bottom of all outbound email message text.
A variable field that supports a specific email address (janedoe@company.com) or templated value ($emailaddress$). EMMs can use this field to pull user credentials from ActiveDirectory.

A string containing the EAS (Exchange ActiveSync) device ID, which may be used by some EMM gateways to correlate devices. (This setting is ignored when set to empty or an Exchange account is already presented in the managed profile).

The complete hostname for the ActiveSync server, such as hostname.company.com:443. The hostname may be accessed through an EMM on-site proxy server, a load-balanced VIP (virtual IP) serving multiple ActiveSync servers, or directly to the public CAS (client access server). Specified host should not be redirected to another host. Defaults to port 443 unless specified otherwise.
A non-empty string alias for a private key certificate stored in the work-profile keystore by an EMM’s DPC app that will be used for authenticating to the ActiveSync Servers.
A boolean value that enables and requires SSL on port numbers used with Hostname when set to True (default). (This setting is ignored when port 443 is used in Hostname).

A boolean value that disables validation checks on SSL certificates used in communications between ActiveSync servers, proxies, or gateways, and other email servers. Set to True to disable validation checks when using self-signed Certificates or for testing purposes. By default, this value is False: validation checks are performed.
"A variable field for user's Active Directory username that can be specified as a direct username (janedoe) or templated value ($username$). The username and user's email address may be different."
Server settings for %1$s are incorrect. Please contact your IT admin.
This email has an attachment that allows unverified scripts to run on your device when opened. Be careful.
Allows the app to send Gmail messages without opening the Gmail app.
